alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 05 at 7:59PM CST until March 05 at 11:00PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CST FOR HENRY...EASTERN VAN BUREN...EASTERN JEFFERSON...NORTHWESTERN LEE AND NORTHWESTERN CLARK COUNTIES... At 759 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Wyman to near Bonaparte, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Winfield and Olds around 805 PM CST. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Donnellson, Franklin, St. Paul, Pilot Grove and Lowell. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CST for southeastern Iowa...and northeastern Missouri. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
